author: kameshj
msg: Code cleanup.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(do_single_file_merge): Record mergeinfo after merging all merge ranges.

author: lgo
msg: Follow up r27412: Fix build on Windows.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(svn_client_merge_peg3): declare revrange at start of block.

author: kameshj
msg: Code cleanup.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(determine_merges_performed): Since r26803 merge is always on a target,
and we run 'determine_merges_performed' only on the same target so no need
to ensure it in the code again.

author: lgo
msg: Small code improvement, no functional change.
Suggested by: dlr
* subversion/libsvn_ra_neon/commit.c
(do_checkout):  set error to SVN_NO_ERROR after clearing.

author: cmpilato
msg: In a nutshell, rework the changes made in r27133 by moving the
iteration over revision ranges to just inside the
svn_client_merge_peg3 API.
The unfortunately reality is that this meant rolling this file back to
r27132 and cherry-picking changes I wanted to re-apply from after that
point, then reworking the basic notion of r27133.  This is for
correctness -- having the main worker functions accept two URLs and
range of revisions makes it extremely different for those worker
functions to deal with merges from sources which suffered location
changes (renames) somewhere between the first and last revisions
merged.
NOTE: r27133 seems to have actually been about two different changes.
One of them was the change of the public merge API to accept a
revision range list instead of just a pair of revisions -- that's what
I meant to rework.  The second change is something to do with talking
about 3-way-merges instead of rollbacks.  I don't know why the two
changes had to be bundled.  And I don't why the fact that I reverted
both changes and then reworked only the first hasn't caused the test
suite to fail at all.  And I'm sad to say that I didn't even realize
there was this dual change thing going on until I started composing
this log message just prior to commit.  Something tells me that second
change will need to be remade, but I'm going to defer that until
another commit.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(get_hi_lo_revs_in_rangelist, merge_type_3_way_merge): Removed.
(calculate_requested_ranges, determine_merges_performed,
mark_mergeinfo_as_inheritable_for_a_range): Operate on a single
range instead of a list thereof.
(calculate_merge_ranges): Rename a parameter, and revert is_rollback
-> is_three_way_merge changes.
(update_wc_mergeinfo, grok_range_info_from_opt_revisions,
remove_first_range_from_remaining_ranges,
record_mergeinfo_for_record_only_merge): Revert is_rollback ->
is_three_way_merge changes.
(assume_default_rev_range): Add in/out youngest_rev parameter.
(calculate_remaining_ranges, populate_remaining_ranges): Operate on
a single range instead of a list thereof.  Revert is_rollback ->
is_three_way_merge changes.
(get_nearest_end_rev, get_farthest_end_rev): Lose previous_range parameter.
(do_merge, do_single_file_merge, discover_and_merge_children):
Operate on a pair of revisions instead of range list.  Revert
is_rollback -> is_three_way_merge changes.
(svn_client_merge3): Update calls to do_merge, do_single_file_merge,
and discover_and_merge_children.
(svn_client_merge_peg3): Handle iteration over revision ranges here.
Update calls to do_merge, do_single_file_merge, and
discover_and_merge_children.
